fields.title: NOC

fields.title: Lack of autonomy in the deployments
fields.description: As a developer of [Organization Name], I find that it is increasingly risky to deploy in the ACC/FORM/PROD environments because we rely on the infrastructure team, and the tools in place do not enable us to react quickly and independently in case of a deployment failure.

fields.title: Complexity of the common project template
fields.description: As a developer of a development team, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to work with a common project template because the various supported cases add a lot of conditions to the code, and the main method has a high cyclomatic complexity.

fields.title: Coupling between unit tests and production code
fields.description: As a developer of a development team, I find that it is increasingly difficult to keep unit tests up to date because the existing tests are tightly coupled with the code structure, making code refactoring impossible.

fields.title: Lack of integration testing capabilities
fields.description: As a back-end developer of a development team, I find that it is increasingly risky to deploy a new version because we don't have feedback on whether the integration is working.

fields.title: Architecture instability
fields.description: As a developer of a development team, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to debug/refactor because some architectural/technical decisions have been changed multiple times.

fields.title: Feature creep makes testing hard
fields.description: As a developer of a development team, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to perform end-to-end tests because the features are becoming more numerous, and sometimes, minor modifications lead to breaking changes.

fields.title: Documentation not up to date
fields.description: As a developer of a development team, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to refer to the internal documentation because it's not always up-to-date.

fields.title: Too much copy-pasting between tools
fields.description: As an analyst and user of Azure DevOps, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to copy user stories into Azure DevOps from the requirements document because it's copy-pasting.

fields.title: Complex structure in Azure DevOps
fields.description: As a user of Azure DevOps, I find that it is increasingly difficult to make sense of things in the projects because the structure is not user-friendly.

fields.title: No centralization of received requests
fields.description: As a developer of project collaboration spaces, I find that it is increasingly risky to not centralize the flow of requests addressed to the team because information can get lost, backups may not exist and the service's continuity could be interrupted.

fields.title: Too much pressure on deadlines
fields.description: As a developer of project collaboration spaces, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to address business issues within these applications because, at times, the resolution is urgent, the problem is complex, and the documentation is weak or even nonexistent.

fields.title: No prior assessment of open source dependencies
fields.description: As a security expert of the Application Security Team, I find that it is increasingly difficult to manage the risks posed by open-source components because there is a lack of visibility and validation.

fields.title: Lack of penetration tests
fields.description: As a security expert of the Application Security team, I find that it is increasingly risky to not conduct application penetration tests because the lack of penetration tests limits visibility on security risks/vulnerabilities.

fields.title: Lack of penetration tests
fields.description: As a security expert of the Application Security team, I find that it is increasingly risky to not conduct application penetration tests because it limits visibility on security vulnerabilities that are (easily) exploitable.

fields.title: Production of security findings
fields.description: As a security expert of the Application Security team, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to compile reports on the quality/security of applications because the reports have to be compiled manually since there is no integrated dashboarding solution.

fields.title: Endless interruptions
fields.description: As a developer of the Dev Support front-end team, I find that it is increasingly difficult to stay focused and make swift progress on certain development tasks because I'm interrupted multiple times for various requests from the developers.

fields.title: Lack of communication
fields.description: As a developer of the Dev Support front-end team, I find that it is increasingly difficult to be aware of certain needs from the development teams because, at times, they don't report the issues they encounter and find workarounds to achieve their goals, sometimes deviating from the standards.

fields.title: Lack of feedback regarding standards
fields.description: As a developer of the Dev Support front-end team, I find that it is increasingly difficult to ensure that the standards are well understood by the teams because there are very few developers who provide feedback, even during dedicated discussions.

fields.title: Unavailability of needed colleagues
fields.description: As a developer of the Dev Support front-end team, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to wait for team members to be available to analyze the pull requests because they also have other tasks/aren't able to dedicate time to it.

fields.title: Not enough time to conduct tests
fields.description: As a developer of the Dev Support front-end team, I find that it is increasingly risky to have to deploy components quickly in order to meet urgent demands because we don't have enough time to conduct sufficient tests.

fields.title: Unit testing takes too much time
fields.description: As a developer of the Dev Support front-end team, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to implement all the tests on web components because they haven't been implemented in the past due to pressing requests or other reasons.

fields.title: Documentation not up to date
fields.description: As a member of the Dev Support team, I find that it is increasingly difficult to access up-to-date documentation because adding new documentation can conflict with existing documentation that we're unaware of, and the Azure DevOps tool is not intuitive and not structured enough to have accurate documentation.

fields.title: Lack of human resources
fields.description: As a front-end developer of the Dev Support team, I find that it is increasingly risky to not be able to closely track the various developments of the teams because we do not have the necessary time/resources to monitor them.

fields.title: Accessibility guidelines change too much
fields.description: As a developer of the Dev Support team, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to adapt components to meet accessibility standards because the concerned guidelines evolve regularly as the individuals in charge of them are still in training.

fields.title: Not enough feedback on shared components
fields.description: As a MOD developer of the Dev Support team, I find that it is increasingly risky to develop shared components because we have limited feedback from developers on how they use them.

fields.title: No information on shared components usage
fields.description: As a MOD developer of the Dev Support team, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to ensure that teams are using our shared components because we don't have a clear view of the usage.

fields.title: Lack of error reporting when updating CI/CD pipelines
fields.description: As a MOD developer of the Dev Support team, I find that it is increasingly risky to update the CI/CD pipelines because we don't have quick feedback on our errors.

fields.title: Not enough information on how the teams use Azure DevOps
fields.description: As a MOD developer of the Dev Support team, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to know the rules that teams use in Azure DevOps because we don't have a clear view of the usage.

fields.title: Lack of flexibility in architectural decisions
fields.description: As a MOD developer of the Dev Support team, I find that it is increasingly difficult to propose architectural solutions because our deployment model doesn't accommodate different use cases.

fields.title: Significant changes in Azure DevOps API
fields.description: As a MOD developer of the Dev Support team, I find that it is increasingly costly to update our guidelines because Microsoft is making significant changes to their Azure DevOps APIs.

fields.title: Lack of technical context when trying to help development teams
fields.description: As a MOD developer of the Dev Support team, I find that it is increasingly difficult to provide relevant answers to questions from developers because developers don't provide us with sufficient context for their issues, and I can't easily run their application to observe the application's behavior.

fields.title: Developers do not contribute to shared components enough
fields.description: As a MOD developer of the Dev Support team, I find that it is increasingly difficult to motivate developers to add features to the shared components because they don't have time to collaborate and advocate for their code.

fields.title: Inadequate tooling for remote pair programming
fields.description: As a MOD developer of the Dev Support team, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to engage in remote pair programming because I can't physically point or use a pointer on the other person's screen to highlight the part of the code I want to provide feedback on.

fields.title: Digital Channels team is understaffed
fields.description: As an analyst of the Development Department, I find that it is increasingly difficult to request a mock-up (and receive it on time) from the Digital Channels team because this team is understaffed.

fields.title: Mockups do not make it clear when new features in web components are required
fields.description: As a front-end developer of the Development Methodologies and Tools team, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to detect new Web Components features in the mock-ups of the Digital Channels team because the functionality does not exist.

fields.title: Lack of testing in shared components
fields.description: As a front-end developer of the Development Methodologies and Tools team, I find that it is increasingly risky to update a shared component quickly because the unit tests are not present or complete.

fields.title: Unit tests in web components are done too late
fields.description: As a front-end developer of the Front/UI team, I find that it is increasingly risky to modify front-end components because the unit tests were not created on time.

fields.title: Migration to .NET Core more complex than first thought
fields.description: As a back-end developer of the GTS application, I find that it is increasingly difficult to understand the technical needs during the migration of certain components to .NET Core (e.g., those related to Hangfire) because it forced us to rethink the architecture of the application.

fields.title: Too much red tape in the deployment process
fields.description: As an application manager of the Helsinki team, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to deploy in an environment because the process is very structured.

fields.title: Lack of training regarding the management of sensitive data in our applications
fields.description: As an analyst of the IT Department, I find that it is increasingly dangerous to deal with sensitive data and use it in applications because there is a lack of training on the use and securing of sensitive data.

fields.title: The number of dependencies make it hard to debug
fields.description: As a developer of the IT Department, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to debug because there are too many dependencies.

fields.title: End-to-end testing complicated
fields.description: As a developer of the IT Department, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to perform end-to-end tests of the application because the number of test cases are increasing over time, and we lack specialized profiles.

fields.title: Knowledge of legacy technology has vanished
fields.description: As a developer of the IT Department, I find that it is increasingly difficult to maintain legacy scripts/programs because the only person who knew them has retired, and no one is motivated to learn the languages used.

fields.title: Too many sources of information
fields.description: As a member of the IT Department, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to have to manage multiple sources of data because there are non-centralized pieces of information.

fields.title: Hotfix process is complicated
fields.description: As a member of the IT Department, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to have to deploy hotfixes for the IAR application on a regular basis because this disrupts the organization of days when application deployments are not normally planned.

fields.title: Too many tools and too much copy-pasting
fields.description: As a member of the IT Department, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to have to work with multiple tools (Azure DevOps, Jira, EasyVista) because I have to regularly input the same information in multiple places.

fields.title: Not clear which application uses which security-related component
fields.description: As a MOD developer of the MOD team, I find that it is increasingly risky to maintain security-related components because I don't have a clear vision of the applications that call upon these libraries.

fields.title: Too many teams to support
fields.description: As a member of the MOD team, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to make technical or methodological changes because the number of teams is significant (communication issues, tracking, etc.).

fields.title: Integration tests are complicated because we lack a cartography
fields.description: As a MOD developer of the MOD team, I find that it is increasingly risky to address technical debt within the components because the actual integration tests are conducted within the applications, and it's difficult/impossible to cover cases of which we aren't aware of.

fields.title: Incompatible front end technologies (standards not respected)
fields.description: As a front-end developer of the Oslo team, I find that it is increasingly difficult to stay up to date with UI/UX standards because the use of the React framework does not allow the integration of Web Components.

fields.title: Graphic charter hard to implement in our front end stack
fields.description: As a front-end developer of the Oslo team, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to follow the organization's graphic charter because the technologies used do not allow for easy integration of standards.

fields.title: Too much red tape when help from another team is needed
fields.description: As a lead developer of the Rio team, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to request a task to be performed by cross-functional teams because too many procedures put in place by teams, which hampers velocity.

fields.title: Not enough feedback from end users
fields.description: As a member of the Software Development Subdepartment, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to not have a user-centered approach from the start because this leads to negative feedback about the end users' experience with the applications.

fields.title: Lack of integration testing environement
fields.description: As a director of the Software Development Subdepartment, I find that it is increasingly risky to not have an integration environment because it becomes impossible to test the applications before moving to Acceptance.

fields.title: The team in charge of the API Gateway is a bottleneck
fields.description: As a director of the Software Development Subdepartment, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to deploy APIs because the work can only be done by a single team, creating a bottleneck.

fields.title: Lack of filtering capability in the "citizens" data repository
fields.description: As a director of the Software Development Subdepartment, I find that it is increasingly difficult to to interact with the "citizens" data repository because key sorting or filtering functionalities are not performing well.

fields.title: Lack of automated reporting capability
fields.description: As a director of the Software Development Subdepartment, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to extract useful data from Jira because I'm forced to perform exports to Excel for further manipulations.

fields.title: Lack of followups after meetings
fields.description: As a web designer of the UI/UX team, I find that it is increasingly difficult to clearly keep track of all the decisions made during meetings and follow their developments because we do not have a shared dashboard / tracking tool.

fields.title: Lack of business knowledge in assessing security risks
fields.description: As a security expert of the Application Security team, I find that it is increasingly difficult to assess the security risks related to a specific application because there is a lack of understanding of the potential impact on the business.

fields.title: Getting access to the web service is tedious
fields.description: As a lead developer of the Rio team, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to request access to Web services because there is a lack of time, and sharing the technical aspects could be beneficial.

fields.title: Inability to use the right tools because they are deemed too expensive
fields.description: As a Sharepoint developer of the PowerAutomate flows, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to not be able to use certain available tools at [organization name] (e.g., Power Apps) that are better suited for the task because the budget constraints related to these tools are high.

fields.title: Difficulty of adhering to infrastructure and security constraints
fields.description: As a developer of the NOC application, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to create a solution that adheres to [organization name]'s infrastructure and security constraints because it is very challenging to identify the stakeholders that facilitate their understanding and implementation.

fields.title: Application for editing mail templates is unstable, leading to time loss
fields.description: As a developer of the Dev Support front-end team, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to update the email template because the application for editing them is very slow and can crash without any automatic saving of the work done.

fields.title: Lack of participation from the teams in updating shared Web components
fields.description: As a developer of the Dev Support front-end team, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to address all requests for updates or fixes to shared components because development teams rarely suggest making fixes themselves and offering Pull Requests.

fields.title: The size of our screens makes code comparison less than optim
fields.description: As a developer of a development team, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to compare file versions because our screens don't allow placing two versions of the file side by side without horizontal scrolling.

fields.title: Lack of communication and support from other IT Subdepartments
fields.description: As a member of the IT Department, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to not always have clear communication or support from other Subdepartments because this gives a feeling of placing obstacles in the way and not wanting to work together.

fields.title: Lack of communication with end users
fields.description: As a member of the Software Development Subdepartment, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to not be consistently in touch with the end users of our applications because we don't always realize the effort required to use our applications.

fields.title: Lack of agility
fields.description: As a director of the Software Development Subdepartment, I find that it is increasingly time-consuming to not have a fully agile organization because the 'waterfall' governance in place multiplies the stakeholders and deliverables.

fields.title: The Integration team lacks attention to the needs of the 'client' applications
fields.description: As a director of the Software Development Subdepartment, I find that it is increasingly frustrating to depend on certain APIs from the Integration team because the team is not attentive to the needs of the 'client' applications.
